events.title: Oliver Cromwell Dissolves the Rump Parliament
events.description: Oliver Cromwell forcibly dissolved the Rump Parliament, marking a key moment in the English Civil War and leading to the establishment of the Protectorate.
events.significance: This event was crucial in the transition of England from a monarchy to a republican commonwealth under Cromwell's rule.

events.title: Birth of Adolf Hitler
events.description: Adolf Hitler, who would become the leader of Nazi Germany and a central figure in World War II, was born in Braunau am Inn, Austria.
events.significance: His leadership led to significant global conflict and changes in the political landscape of the 20th century.

events.title: Mona Lisa is Returned to the Louvre
events.description: After being stolen in 1911, the famous painting "Mona Lisa" by Leonardo da Vinci was recovered and returned to the Louvre Museum in Paris.
events.significance: The theft and recovery of the painting brought international attention to art theft and helped solidify the Mona Lisa's fame.

events.title: Columbine High School Massacre
events.description: Two students carried out a mass shooting at Columbine High School in Colorado, killing 12 students and 1 teacher, before committing suicide.
events.significance: This tragic event sparked national debates on gun control, school safety, and youth violence in the United States.
